cont.entity_a: Signal strength reduces with walls in between.
cont.entity_b: Wireless signal strength is strong and never drops.

cont.entity_a: Does not work with DSL and gets hot, so should not be covered. Not suitable for use directly on a DSL modem. Works with cable internet connections.
cont.entity_b: Works great with Xbox Live and Nintendo Wi-Fi after firmware upgrade.

cont.entity_a: There are issues with DNS passthrough in shared mode.
cont.entity_b: Zero downtime except when configuring settings. Requires advanced knowledge for setup of certain features.

cont.entity_a: Lightweight with a carry case, suitable for travel.
Router stopped working after the warranty expired. Requires daily reboot and has difficulty with WEP configuration.
cont.entity_b: Extremely stable with fantastic range. Fast and reliable with many advanced settings. Handles many connections without slowing down. Fast, reliable, and recommended for gaming and heavy usage.

Supports strong WiFi encryption for wireless access points. Performs well with multiple devices and gaming systems. Good for prioritizing packet routing and has a user-friendly interface. Lacks 802.11n specs but has MIMO system for higher speeds.

cont.entity_a: Gets hot, so should not be covered.
cont.entity_b: Overheats when stacked under another device.
